data.title: German anti-vaccer wagers € 100,000 to anyone proving the existance of the measles virus. Researcher sends him articles proving the virus' existance and takes him to court where he's ordered to pay the full amount.
The Pirate Party is now measured as the second biggest party in Iceland with 22% in new poll
Canadian school takes 21 students out of school as parents refuse to vaccinate them while a measles outbreak reaches 119 cases
Penis transplant declared successful for the first time in history
South African mercenaries--seen as relics of apartheid after officially being banned in 1998--are now back in action in Nigeria, where they're covertly "whacking" Boko Haram in nighttime raids
Statues destroyed by Islamic State in Mosul were copies
Russian channel 'Rossiya 24' prematurely reports on Putin meeting which has yet to happen.
Poll: 74% of Chinese citizens say their military could defeat the United States and Japan in conflict over disputed islands.
ISIS Has Lost 25 Percent of Territory It Once Held in Iraq, US Says
Chilling Syrian numbers: 83% of electricity cut, life expectancy drops 20 years
